title: Two-Ingredient Pizza Dough Recipe
description: This 2-ingredient pizza dough is super simple to make with just self-rising flour and Greek yogurt for a tender, crisp crust in less than 30 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Pizza Dough and Crust Recipes Two-Ingredient Pizza Dough 4.6 (330) 298 Reviews 127 Photos This 2-ingredient pizza dough is fast and easy to make and tastes great! Greek yogurt is the secret ingredient and baking the crust at a higher temperature is the key to making this the perfect pizza. It doesn't get any easier than this folks. Brush dough with olive oil, add your favorite toppings, and enjoy! Submitted by Michele Leigh Pinette Pierce Updated on March 28, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 127 127 127 127 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 12-inch crust Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 ½ cups self-rising flour, plus more for kneading 1 cup plain Greek yogurt cooking spray Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Mix flour and Greek yogurt together in a bowl to form a dough; transfer to a work surface floured with self-rising flour. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Knead dough, adding more flour as needed to keep dough from being too sticky, about 8 to 10 minutes. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Spray a 12-inch pizza pan with cooking spray and spread dough to the edges of the pan. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Bake pizza crust in preheated oven for 5 to 7 minutes; add your favorite toppings and return to the preheated oven. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Bake until crust is lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes more. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Enjoy! Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Recipe Tips Make sure to cook at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Otherwise, your crust will not brown on the bottom nicely and will be soft.Double the recipe if using a 16-inch pizza pan. I Made It Print 1,096 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 116 Calories 3g Fat 18g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 116 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 4% Saturated Fat 1g 7% Cholesterol 6mg 2% Sodium 314mg 14% Total Carbohydrate 18g 7% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 1g Protein 4g 8% Calcium 79mg 6% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 29mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. Add Your Photo Photos of Two-Ingredient Pizza Dough 01 of 127 Photo by  Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck 02 of 127 Photo by  LivelyCow1858 03/27/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Can't believe how easy this was to make with store-cupboard ingredients. And you don't need to wait for any proving/rising. Will definitely use this recipe to whip up quick pizzas and breads in the future. 03 of 127 Photo by  HappyBeet4720 01/05/2025 A keeper! Worth the effort Easy to follow I’m back on WW, so I used protein pancake mix instead of flour. I mixed garlic, basil, and oregano into the dough. I rolled it out long and thin -rustic flatbread style. Topped with pizza sauce, sliced garlic; sliced string cheese, and turkey pepperoni. If I had fresh basil that would’ve gone on there too. Next time I’m going to do a white sauce with spinach and chopped artichokes. I can’t wait! 04 of 127 Photo by  Bloopy 12/12/2024 OK with tweaks Ratio needs way more flour, at least for my Greek yoghurt. I used a ½ cup of yoghurt to 1¼ cups of flour up front and it was barely sticky at all. Once most of it's in a dough, fold the remaining loose bits in. So much easier to work with. I didn't need to add any more flour. I spread it reasonably thin and then put it on baking paper instead of using cooking spray. My amounts made a 12" × 8.5" rectangular pizza. I like the simplicity of the base and don't feel the need to add seasoning. I put all my toppings on first before baking for 10 minutes. Next time I may preheat my tray, try a thicker crust and bake it for a few minutes first before adding toppings. There's a lot of variation you can try in this regard that the recipe doesn't mention. 05 of 127 Photo by  DANA 08/23/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow I made pretzels.The dough taste a little like sourdough,so I think I’ll not make changes . (I sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon before baking).They would have been better plain,baked and eaten dipped in mustard of choice . It’s a keeper.Next I’ll try and make a pizza ! 06 of 127 Photo by  CoolMixer2019 06/27/2023 Oh wow best recipe eva my kids luv it 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾 07 of 127 Photo by  Tonya 03/05/2023 This was fantastic just as is! I was very happy with the easiness of this recipe!! 2 ingredients=wonderful!Next time, I will add the suggested garlic, basil....but I wanted to try it as is first. I will definitely make this and all the other suggestions! Thank you for sharing this awesome recipe! 08 of 127 Photo by  Classie Cyndi 02/09/2023 So simple, and perfect, I will be making this again. 09 of 127 Photo by  KeenLamb3279 01/26/2023 Light, Easy and delicious.Used tipo pasta '00' flour and converted that to Self Raising Flour. I had to use extra flour to reduce the stickyness but it didnt change the cooking outcome.Will use this recipe from now on instead of buying pizza bases.Will do this to make mini lunch pizzas in the airfryer 😊 10 of 127 Photo by  Regina1267 12/23/2022 We really enjoyed pizza with this dough. I will say that it tastes better if you add garlic powder and sea salt to the flour before mixing in the Greek yogurt. We used pepperoni, bacon, mozerella and parmesean cheese to the top. Be aware that the crust will be thick. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love No-Yeast Pizza Crust 534 Ratings Great-Gram Grosso's Pizza Crust 2 Ratings Real Italian Pizza Dough 2 Ratings Italian Feather Bread Pizza Dough 77 Ratings Thin-Crust Pizza Dough 337 Ratings Sourdough Pizza Crust 5 Ratings Premium Pizza Crust 194 Ratings Famous California Pizza Dough 12 Ratings Sicilian Pizza Crust 2 Ratings Ricardo's Pizza Crust 271 Ratings Perfect Every Time Pizza or Calzone Dough 138 Ratings Pizza Oven Dough 12 Ratings Gluten-Free Pizza Crust or Flatbread 13 Ratings Pork Rind Pizza Crust Patrick's Gluten-Free Pizza Crust Keto Fathead Pizza with Chorizo and Salsa 4 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Michele Leigh Pinette Pierce

Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Mix flour and Greek yogurt together in a bowl to form a dough; transfer to a work surface floured with self-rising flour. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Knead dough, adding more flour as needed to keep dough from being too sticky, about 8 to 10 minutes. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Spray a 12-inch pizza pan with cooking spray and spread dough to the edges of the pan. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Bake pizza crust in preheated oven for 5 to 7 minutes; add your favorite toppings and return to the preheated oven. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Bake until crust is lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes more. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck;Enjoy! Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck
